stories.text: I saw news about those cartop ad companies like Firefly, Halo by Lyft, and Uber OOH. Those are for taxi/ridesharing vehicles only. Is there any regulation/legal reason so they are not doing this for non-ridesharing vehicles? I feel the places I visit most are schools, grocery stores, shopping center/mall, outdoor parks, in which are mostly residence/personal vehicles other than taxi/ridesharing.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why is there no cartop advertising for personal vehicles?

stories.text:
Has anyone done the two part MOOC (now on edX) by Gregor Kiczales from the University of British Columbia that is based on the book How to Design Programs (https://htdp.org/)? The MOOCs are called: 1. How to Code: Simple Data 2. How to Code: Complex Data

Previously they were called Systematic Program Design 1, 2, ..

How are the courses in comparison to the actual book?
stories.title: Ask HN: MOOC Based on How to Design Programs by UBC
